subject: AI & Agents
title: Perplexity: Measuring Surprise
description: A quick win: understand Perplexity: Measuring Surprise.

hook.text: Model A gets 15 perplexity, Model B gets 25. Which is better? Lower is better.

buildup.text: Perplexity measures how 'surprised' the model is by a text. Lower = more confident.

discovery.text: It's the exponent of average cross-entropy loss: how well the model predicts tokens.

twist.text: Low perplexity doesn't mean useful answersâ€”a model can predict well but still hallucinate.

climax.text: Use perplexity to compare base models. Use task-specific evals for real-world quality.

punchline.text: Perplexity tells you prediction, not usefulness.

quiz.question: What does lower perplexity indicate?
options: The model predicts tokens more confidently
